posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.54 beta soon.

If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Using Obtanium? Remember to opt-in for pre-release tags to receive beta updates.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

  • Signal Backups fixes.
  • Large screen UI improvements.
  • Fix chat folders syncing.
  • Stickers keyboard scroll performance improvement.
  • Calling UI fixes.

Complete list of new commits since 7.53.4:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.53.4…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.53 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.54.0 (157700)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

43 new commits since 7.53.4:

Show commits

  • Add proper picture in picture support to compose CallScreen component. [1]

  • Enable edgeToEdge support for compose CallScreen. [2]

  • Do not archive view-once media. [3]

  • Prevent password managers from overwriting backup key with Signal PIN. [4]

    Adding a hidden username field provides additional context for the autofill service, so it knows the username associated with the confirmed PIN should be "Signal PIN" rather than "Signal backup key".

  • Rotate profile key when learning of a block by a linked device. [5]

  • Add performance metrics for archive uploads. [6]

  • Update to latest backup tests. [7]

  • Add support for OutgoingMessageDetails.dateReceived. [8]

  • Upgrade compose to BOM 2025.08.00 [9]

  • Add progress log for dummy message inserts. [10]

  • Prevent potential deadlock when canceling jobs. [11]

  • Fix restore progress bar not clearing after cancel. [12]

  • Fix state restoration when switching between inner and outer screens. [13]

  • Fix full-screen mode for compose call screen. [14]

  • Fix potential crash in notification message generation. [15]

  • Inline deleteSync and SSREv2 capabilities. [16]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.57.0 [17]

  • Add in extra check for serviceId in send job. [18]

  • Improve organization of glide packages. [19]

    Generic image processing classes were scattered alongside Signal-specific Glide code across multiple packages: org.signal.glide, org.thoughtcrime.securesms.glide and org.thoughtcrime.securesms.mms.
    This change provides a clearer separation of concerns:

    • org.signal.glide contains generic image loading components
    • org.thoughtcrime.securesms.glide contains Signal-specific Glide integrations
    • Feature-specific loaders are moved to their respective domain packages (e.g. .badges, .contacts)

  • Fix unresponsiveness of calling screen when in landscape. [20]

  • Fixes a significant memory leak in the sticker keyboard, which caused UI lag and system slowdowns, particularly on lower-end devices. [21]

    Closes signalapp/Signal-Android#14283
    Fixes signalapp/Signal-Android#13770

  • Bump libsignal to v0.78.2 [22]

  • Update SVRB error handling. [23]

  • Remove restriction on proximity lock in landscape calling. [24]

  • Remove direct uses of libsignal internals [25]

  • Allow RestoreAttachmentJob to be retried multiple times. [26]

  • Add debug logging for attachment restore speeds. [27]

  • Fix bugs for chat folders in storage sync. [28]

  • Convert AddAllowedMembersFragment to compose. [29]

  • Various backup strings updates. [30]

  • Convert AccountSettingsFragment from DSL to Compose. [31]

  • Use remote config v2. [32]

  • Convert AdvancedPrivacySettingsFragment to compose. [33]

  • Convert AppUpdatesSettingsFragment to compose. [34]

  • Convert AppearanceSettingsFragment to compose. [35]

  • Fix participant overflow sizing on tablets. [36]

  • Add 'spqr' capability to uploaded AppCapabilities. [37]

  • Fix background corners on Foldables / Tablet layout. [38]

  • Update self-pip placement in compose screen. [39]

  • Add dynamic scaling to our JobRunner system. [40]

  • Update translations and other static files. [41]

  • Update baseline profile. [42]

  • Bump version to 7.54.0 [43]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.53.4…v7.54.0

Localization changes

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
jeffrey-signal:
  • Large screen UI improvements.
  • Fix chat folders syncing.

am i correct in understanding this is progress both on Android tablets as secondary devices and in chat folders on secondary devices, or am i reading too much into this?

rassilon1963:
jeffrey-signal:
  • Large screen UI improvements.
  • Fix chat folders syncing.

am i correct in understanding this is progress both on Android tablets as secondary devices and in chat folders on secondary devices, or am i reading too much into this?

Progress on tablet/foldable UI. The chat folders change is a bug fix.

link_counts.title: Allow Android / iOS devices (e.g. tablets, but also phones) to be linked to the primary device, i.e. used as secondary device like the Desktop app

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Huh, I was able to update Signal to 7.53.4 using a notification from the app. Very cool! First time this happened to me.

Tapping the notification didn’t work immediately, because the app didnt have the permissions to install APKs, but as soon as I opened the app, tapping the notification requested those permissions and it worked!

I didn’t get another one for 7.54.0 and had to update using Obtainium.

As I have already reported here Beta Feedback for the upcoming Android 7.52 release - #5 by erik55

this story bug is really strange.

If a video of 40 seconds is send, I can see the hole video as a receiver ON DESKTOP. But only the first 30 seconds on Android, the rest is lost (dismissed). But when reshared, then you can see the full video again is sender and as receiver (split at 30 seconds).

But this only applies to individual stories, not to stories sent to groups, there it seems to worrk correctly.

Can you please fix? And when was this introduced???

link_counts.title: Beta Feedback for the upcoming Android 7.52 release
Splitting and sending large videos to story does not work

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked: Would you be able to add a debug log for this most recent attempt as well as a rough timestamp of when it happened? I remember looking at it last time and nothing jumped out as concerning, and since we haven’t reproduced it internally, another log would be great to investigate with.

posts.name: Julio Nahum
posts.cooked:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.53.3/c467532e781dedf0000eca15c30d905be4a7ba94ce175df9abffa37336b26d6d
(Story uploaded without modification, only a 30-second clip is uploaded, the other clips are not)

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.53.3/b720ea0f64ffd0564e2bfffbc36cf31b4123b9b5f2bfbb30adfdc22c137158ae
(The modified story uploads three 30-second clips, but each clipped story has a few extra milliseconds cut out, so the cut of each story doesn’t match the video very well.) It would be nice if they raised the story limit to 1 minute and then made the cut properly. The video clips uploaded to the story should match up well, so there aren’t any extra milliseconds cut out. Is that clear?

posts.name: 0xnor0
posts.cooked: Random crashes after opening chats. log after restart: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.54.0/ea96ac4e45296bcdeb77bfa0c3140f839dc4506d7fac2049e796df0c7196b61f

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked: Are these consistent crashes every time you open the chat or just once in a while?

posts.name: 0xnor0
posts.cooked:
it seems randomly. but after the crash the app works normally again.

before the crash an opening of a chat results in a “crash”/fallback to the main chat list after some seconds (app seems unresponsible in this time) but then after a few seconds the app crashes completely.

posts.cooked: Did something get tagged wrong? Obtanium says I have a new update, but it’s pulling down 7.54.0 again and giving me an “old version” error.
Now it says 5.53.5 is the latest version .

posts.cooked:
Direct link

Releases · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

Hi.

10000197071280×2800 180 KB

posts.cooked: I just had constant crashes and the app was unusable. after installing 7.54.1 and trying to open a chat with pictures in new messages.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: WAIT!? THE STICKER KEYBOARD IS FAST NOW. THANK YOU!! Actually an amazing change for me.
Faded rendering instead of rendering all at once. Awesome change. It used to stutter pretty badly, but now it’s super smooth.

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

Did something get tagged wrong?

Ah my bad. There was a new beta release and hot fix to production so I think you ended up getting notifications for both but only one is meaningful to you. Hopefully it wasn’t too annoying to dismiss.

I just had constant crashes and the app was unusable.

Tracking.
